citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At time of inspection, the program of veterinary care on file dated 03/16/2018 had not been updated to reflect a change in
attending veterinarian, in which the originally listed attending veterinarian had retired. Not having written formal
arrangements with an attending veterinarian can result in detriments to the health and welfare of animals.
Exhibitors shall have an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements, which includes a written program of veterinary
care to ensure adequate veterinary care is provided to its animals.
Correct by 10 May 2023 by updating the program of veterinary care to reflect the available attending veterinarian(s) under
formal arrangements.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At time of inspection, expired bottles of alfaxolone (expired March 2023) and buprenorphine (expired October 2022) were
found stored in the controlled drug cabinet for potential use. Expired medical products are not an appropriate method to
prevent disease and injury in animals. The licensee must ensure appropriate methods are in place to prevent, control and
treat diseases and injuries, which includes the use of unexpired drugs. Expired drugs must be clearly labeled and stored
in a manner to prevent use prior to appropriate disposal.
Correct from this date forward of 1 May 2023.

At time of inspection, the facility did not have documentation of training on the contingency plan for employees.
Employees must know their roles and responsibilities as outlined in the contingency plan in order to ensure animal care
and welfare in emergent events. The licensee must train personnel on the contingency plan.
Correct by 26 May 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
